intro: Neosasamorpha stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed neosasamorpha, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color, which develop into small, fleshy fruits. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
